intro: Micranthes virginiensis, commonly known as Virginia micranthes, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and often have a slightly hairy texture.
